info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 11:53PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...BAND OF SNOW SHOWERS MOVING INTO WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS AND NORTHWEST CONNECTICUT... HAZARDS...A band of snow showers which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1149 PM EST, snow showers across the Berkshires were moving east at 45 mph and will work into western Massachusetts and northwest Connecticut. A quick coating to one half inch of snow is possible with this activity. Roadways may become slippery. THESE SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE NEAR...Chester, Cummington and Middlefield around 1205 AM EST. Worthington around 1210 AM EST. Huntington, Chesterfield and Goshen around 1215 AM EST. Southampton and Williamsburg around 1225 AM EST. Northampton, Easthampton, Sunderland and Whately around 1230 AM EST. South Hadley, Hadley and Hatfield around 1235 AM EST. Amherst, Granby and Leverett around 1240 AM EST. Pelham around 1245 AM EST. SAFETY INFO... Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&
